text: Kamal Ganzouri (, ; 12 January 1933 â€“ 31 March 2021) was an Egyptian economist and politician. He was the Prime Minister of Egypt from 7 December 2011 to 24 July 2012. He was also prime minister from 1996 to 1999.Fisk, Robert (1996) "Vision of death that Cairo views through Ray-Bans", The Independent, 29 October 1996, Retrieved 13 February 2010. He succeeded Atef Sedki and was succeeded by Atef Ebeid. He was called Minister of the Poor and the Opposition Minister. This was because of how he dealt with poor people and the opposition. Before becoming prime minister, Ganzouri was Minister of Planning and International Cooperation.Africa research bulletin, Volume 22, Retrieved 13 February 20103 On 24 November 2011, Egypt's military rulers made him prime minister.Egypt military 'appoint Kamal Ganzouri as new PM', BBC News, 24 November 2011 He took office on 7 December 2011. Ganzouri died in Cairo on 31 March 2021 at the age of 88.Former Egyptian PM Kamal al-Ganzouri dies aged 88 ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Economists Category:Prime Ministers of Egypt Category:21st-century rulers in Africa
title: Kamal Ganzouri
